Description: Handle-plate sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with scar of handle; interior glazed black; underside of handle-plate reserved; on top: siren, to left with outspread wings; with faded added red on neck, chest and wing mid-band; edges of handle plate black, continuing onto outermost part of underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Amyx, D. A. and Lawrence, P., Corinth: Results of excavations conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens VII.2: Archaic Corinthian Pottery and the Anaploga Well. Princeton 1975, pl. 37, fig. 198 (though facing right).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 109, no. A173)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.046) (Phase 1)
